summary: The "Paris Agreement on Climate Change" represents a pivotal international accord aimed at combating climate change and fostering global cooperation. Within the EU legal and regulatory framework, the Agreement obligates member states to implement nationally determined contributions (NDCs) that reflect their climate ambitions. The EU has committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and enhancing resilience to climate impacts, aligning its policies with the overarching goals of the Agreement. This commitment is integral to the EU's environmental policy, promoting sustainable development and ensuring compliance with international obligations while facilitating a transition to a low-carbon economy.
